intro: Bilabrella furcipetala, commonly known as the forked-lipped bilabrella, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, bilaterally symmetrical flowers with a distinctive forked lip. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Bilabrella furcipetala thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests.
